item.title: 美国法官阻止劳工部最新版信托规则的实施
item.description: 美国一名法官阻止了劳工部一项本可扩大被视为受托人的退休顾问类型的规定生效，认为该规定武断且与管理退休计划的法律相冲突。【原文：A U.S. judge has blocked a Department of Labor rule from taking effect that would have expanded the types of retirement advisers who are considered fiduciaries, finding the rule was arbitrary and conflicted with a law that governs retirement plans.】

item.title: 可能拖垮做空者安德鲁-勒夫的交易
item.description: 美国当局对激进卖空行业的知名人士安德鲁-莱福特（Andrew Left）提出刑事和民事指控，称其多年来一直操纵市场，并在交易中误导投资者。【原文：U.S. authorities filed criminal and civil charges against Andrew Left, a prominent face of the activist short-selling industry, alleging he had for years manipulated the market and defrauded investors with misleading claims about his trades.】

item.title: 贝克休斯认为北美业务量下降，将赌注押在国外需求上
item.description: 贝克休斯周五以北美公司钻井活动减少为由，下调了对石油生产商支出的展望，与其他油田服务公司一道警告该地区经济疲软。【原文：Baker Hughes cut its outlook for spending by oil producers on Friday, citing lower drilling activity by North American companies, joining other oilfield service companies in warning about softness in the region.】

item.title: 消息人士称，亚马逊因逃税在米兰接受第二次调查
item.description: 周五，两位消息人士称，米兰检察官正在对亚马逊的一个意大利部门进行调查，原因是该部门涉嫌逃税。【原文：An Italian unit of Amazon is being investigated by Milan prosecutors for suspected tax evasion, two sources said on Friday, but the inquiry was not linked to a multi-million euro seizure from another of the group's Italian units this week.】

item.title: 丰业银行数千名客户受技术问题影响
item.description: 周五，加拿大丰业银行的数千名客户遇到了技术问题，许多人抱怨工资单丢失和其他问题。【原文：Thousands of Bank of Nova Scotia clients in Canada were experiencing technical issues on Friday, with many complaining about missing paychecks and other problems.】

item.title: 智利科德尔科公司称 2024 年上半年产量下降 8
item.description: 世界最大的铜生产商智利科德尔科公司（Codelco）（COBRE.UL）周五公布，2024 年上半年的产量比去年同期下降了 8.4%，为 579,785 公吨。【原文：Chile's Codelco (COBRE.UL), the world's largest copper producer, on Friday posted a 8.4% drop in output for the first half of 2024 compared with the same period last tear, at 579,785 metric tons.】

item.title: 资深立法者称，YouTube 在俄罗斯速度较慢，谷歌难辞其咎
item.description: 一位与当局关系密切的资深立法者周五表示，由于谷歌未能升级其在俄罗斯的设备并拒绝解封俄罗斯媒体频道，YouTube 在俄罗斯的台式电脑上的运行速度将急剧下降。【原文：YouTube speeds in Russia are set to sharply decline on desktop computers due Google's failure to upgrade its equipment in Russia and its refusal to unblock channels of Russian media, a senior lawmaker close to the authorities said on Friday.】

item.title: Indivior 与美国各州达成 8600 万美元阿片类药物和解协议
item.description: 纽约州总检察长莱蒂西亚-詹姆斯（Letitia James）周五表示，Indivior 公司达成了一项 8600 万美元的和解协议，以解决该公司在全美范围内传播阿片类药物成瘾的问题。【原文：Indivior reached an $86 million settlement to resolve the company's role in spreading opioid addiction across the United States, New York Attorney General Letitia James said on Friday.】

item.title: 白宫表示，苹果公司签署了美国管理人工智能风险的自愿计划
item.description: 白宫周五表示，苹果公司已经签署了美国总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）关于人工智能（AI）的自愿承诺，与其他15家公司一起承诺确保人工智能的力量不被用于破坏性目的。【原文：Apple Inc has signed U.S. President Joe Biden's voluntary commitments governing artificial intelligence (AI), joining 15 other firms that have committed to ensuring that AI's power is not used for destructive purposes, the White House said on Friday.】

item.title: 微软旗下 LinkedIn 与声称其向广告商多收费的诉讼达成和解
item.description: LinkedIn 同意支付 662.5 万美元，以了结一起集体诉讼，该诉讼指控微软公司通过夸大其平台上视频广告的观看人数，向广告商多收费用。【原文：LinkedIn agreed to pay $6.625 million to settle a proposed class action accusing the Microsoft unit of overcharging advertisers by inflating how many people watched video ads on its platform.】

item.title: 联合太平洋公司干预联邦安全审计 -- 参议员
item.description: 美国参议院商业委员会主席周五表示，美国联合太平洋铁路公司在指导员工如何应对后干扰了联邦安全审计，促使铁路机构终止了审查。【原文：U.S. railroad Union Pacific interfered in a federal safety audit after employees were coached in how to respond, prompting the rail agency to end the review, the chair of the Senate Commerce Committee said Friday.】

item.title: 美国股票基金无视科技股大跌吸引资金流入
item.description: 在截至7月24日的七天里，美国投资者继续向股票基金注入资金，摆脱了科技行业的大跌，转而关注强劲的企业盈利和美联储即将降息的可能性。【原文：U.S. investors continued to pump money into equity funds in the seven days to July 24, shrugging off a technology sector selloff to focus on robust corporate earnings and the possibility of upcoming Federal Reserve interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 印度央行对 Visa 未授权支付方式处以罚款
item.description: 印度中央银行周五表示，印度储备银行对 Visa 公司处以 2,410 万卢比（近 28.8 万美元）的罚款，原因是该公司使用了一种未经授权的支付转账方式。【原文：The Reserve Bank of India imposed a penalty of 24.1 million rupees (nearly $288,000) on Visa in relation to its usage of an unauthorised payment transfer method, the central bank said on Friday.】

item.title: 私募股权巨头阿波罗向索尼音乐投资 7 亿美元
item.description: 私募股权巨头阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management）向备受瞩目的唱片公司索尼音乐集团（Sony Music Group）投资了 7 亿美元，使其客户有机会投资 "高等级 "另类资产。【原文：Private equity behemoth Apollo Global Management has invested $700 million in high-profile record label Sony Music Group, allowing its clients an opportunity to invest in "high grade" alternative assets.】

item.title: 美国 6 月通胀温和上升
item.description: 美国 6 月份物价温和上涨，凸显出通胀环境正在改善，这有可能使美联储在 9 月份开始降息。【原文：U.S. prices rose moderately in June, underscoring an improving inflation environment that potentially positions the Federal Reserve to begin cutting interest rates in September.】

item.title: 二十国集团（G20）财政首脑标榜全球经济 "软着陆"，警告战争风险
item.description: 根据路透社看到的联合公报最终草案，二十国集团（G20）金融领导人周五将表示，全球经济 "软着陆 "的可能性正在上升，但警告战争和冲突升级可能危及这一前景。【原文：G20 financial leaders will say on Friday there is a rising likelihood of a global economic "soft landing", but warn wars and escalating conflicts could endanger this outlook, according to the final draft of a joint communique seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 全球股票基金因盈利希望而吸引第五周资金流入
item.description: 截至 7 月 24 日的一周内，全球股票基金迎来了新的投资，尽管主要科技股下挫，因为投资者对第二季度仍然强劲的盈利季节和美联储可能的降息仍持乐观态度。【原文：Global equity funds witnessed fresh investments in the week through July 24 despite a selloff in leading technology stocks as investors remained optimistic about a still-strong second-quarter earnings season, and potential Fed rate cuts.】

item.title: 交易员坚持美联储下周按兵不动、9 月减息的观点
item.description: 周五，与美联储政策利率挂钩的期货合约小幅上扬，此前数据显示上月基本通胀略强于预期，反映出市场对9月开始的一系列降息前景仍有信心。 交易员们仍然相信美联储将在下周的会议上保持利率稳定，并继续押注美联储将在下周的会议上减息。【原文：Futures contracts tied to the Federal Reserve's policy rate on Friday edged up only slightly after data showed underlying inflation last month was a bit stronger than expected, reflecting continued confidence in the prospect of a series of interest rate cuts starting in September. Traders remain convinced the Fed will keep rates steady at its meeting next week, and continue to bet the Fed will del】

item.title: 美国 6 月通胀温和上升
item.description: 美国 6 月份物价温和上涨，凸显出通胀环境正在改善，这有可能使美联储在 9 月份开始降息。【原文：U.S. prices rose moderately in June, underscoring an improving inflation environment that potentially positions the Federal Reserve to begin cutting interest rates in September.】

item.title: 美国起诉安德鲁-勒夫（Andrew Left）涉嫌操纵股市 1,600 万美元
item.description: 美国司法部周五表示，一个联邦大陪审团以多项证券欺诈罪起诉了著名激进做空者安德鲁-莱福特（Andrew Left），指控他长期操纵市场，涉案金额达 1600 万美元。【原文：A federal grand jury has indicted prominent activist short seller Andrew Left on multiple counts of securities fraud for a long-running $16 million market manipulation scheme, the U.S. Justice Department said on Friday.】

item.title: 需求强劲，高露洁-棕榄公司上调 2024 年业绩预期
item.description: 牙膏生产商高露洁-棕榄公司周五上调了对全年利润和有机销售额的预期，此前该公司第二季度业绩超出预期，原因是对其高价产品的需求具有弹性。【原文：Toothpaste maker Colgate-Palmolive raised its forecasts for annual profit and organic sales on Friday, after beating second-quarter estimates on resilient demand for its high-priced products.】

item.title: 美国起诉香橼资本及其创始人安德鲁-勒夫（Andrew Left）涉嫌操纵市场
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会（U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission）和司法部周五起诉做空机构香橼研究公司（Citron Research）及其创始人安德鲁-莱福特（Andrew Left）涉嫌证券欺诈。【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission and the Department of Justice on Friday sued short seller Citron Research and its founder Andrew Left for alleged securities fraud.】

item.title: 消息人士称日产削减日本顶级工厂的产量
item.description: 两位知情人士称，日产汽车本月将把其日本顶级工厂的计划产量削减三分之一，此举还将导致日产汽车削减一款旗舰跨界车型的产量，因为日产汽车正努力应对美国市场对其老化产品阵容的疲软需求。【原文：Nissan cut planned production by a third at its top Japanese plant this month, a move that will also see it slash output of a flagship crossover model, two people said, as it struggles with weak U.S. demand for its ageing line-up.】

item.title: 中国电动汽车电池制造商 CATL 第二季度利润增长 13.4
item.description: 周五提交的一份股票市场文件显示，中国电动汽车电池巨头 CATL 第二季度净利润同比增长 13.4%，连续第二个季度实现增长。【原文：Chinese electric vehicle battery giant CATL's second-quarter net profit jumped 13.4% year on year, a stock market filing showed on Friday, extending gains for a second straight quarter.】

item.title: 财政部可能暂时保持大部分拍卖规模稳定
item.description: 美国财政部很可能在下周宣布，将在下一季度保持大部分附息美国国债拍卖规模的稳定，这将使市场在近期大幅加息后得到一些缓解。【原文：The U.S. Treasury Department is likely to announce next week that it will keep most of its coupon-bearing U.S. Treasury auction sizes steady over the coming quarter, offering the market some relief after recent large increases.】

item.title: 受市场反弹提振，T Rowe Price利润大增
item.description: 资产管理公司 T Rowe Price 周五公布，第二季度调整后利润增长了 11%，这主要得益于市场的持续反弹提升了客户的投资价值，并减轻了资金外流带来的冲击。【原文：Asset manager T Rowe Price reported an 11% jump in second-quarter adjusted profit on Friday, helped by a relentless market rally that has boosted the value of clients' investments and softened the hit from an outflow of funds.】

item.title: 据 CNBC 报道，巴里-迪勒称派拉蒙对 IAC 的追求 "可能已经结束"。
item.description: 据 CNBC 周五报道，亿万富翁巴里-迪勒（Barry Diller）表示，他的数字媒体集团 IAC 不再参与收购派拉蒙全球公司（Paramount Global）的竞争。【原文：Billionaire Barry Diller signaled his digital-media conglomerate IAC was no longer in the race to buy Paramount Global , CNBC reported on Friday.】

item.title: 保险公司 Mapfre 受美国经济复苏和自然灾害减少的提振
item.description: 西班牙保险公司 Mapfre 周五表示，由于自然灾害减少且更加温和，以及在美国的汽车保险业务出现转机，该公司上半年净利润大幅增长。【原文：Spanish insurer Mapfre said on Friday its first-half net profit jumped thanks to fewer and more benign natural disasters and a turnaround in its car insurance business in the United States.】

item.title: 独家报道沃尔玛欲斥资 2 亿美元打造自动驾驶叉车--消息人士
item.description: 据三位熟知内情的人士透露，沃尔玛计划斥资 2 亿美元购买自动驾驶叉车，作为更广泛的仓库自动化工作的一部分。【原文：Walmart has plans to potentially spend $200 million on self-driving forklifts as part of broader efforts to automate more warehouse operations, according to three people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 德克斯户外（Deckers Outdoor）股价大涨，原因是霍卡（Hoka）和 UGG 鞋类的全价销售有助于上调财年利润预期
item.description: 德克斯户外（Deckers Outdoor）周五盘前股价大涨 11%，至 932 美元，此前这家运动服装公司上调了年度利润预期，押注于热销的 Hoka 跑鞋和 UGG 靴子的全价销售。【原文：Deckers Outdoor shares jumped 11% to $932 before the bell on Friday after the sportswear company raised its annual profit forecast, betting on full-price sales of its hot-selling Hoka running shoes and UGG boots.】
